strings.Value: "What awaits Darven in Cheliax?"
"Execute the criminal here and now."
"Let him live. Mammon will punish him, one way or another."
"Do as you will."
"An exemplary execution? Too bad I can't go with you to watch it."
"I accept your offer. The Hellknights of the Order of the Rack will always be welcome guests in my lands."
"Leave Darven alone and get out of my lands."
"I'm not afraid of you. Come and bring your hellknights with you. I'll wait."
[Attack] "You've tested my patience for too long."
"Just leave. I don't want to see you anymore."
"I've helped you to catch Darven. Where's my reward?"

"So, what now, Darven? Where's all your arrogance gone? What do you say now, laying in a pool of your own blood?" {n}Linxia's eyes sparkle with pleasure. Her sword swings lazily from side to side, close to Darven's throat.{/n}

{n}Without taking his eyes from the Linxia's blade, Darven makes an effort to spit out blood.{/n} "Well, I know what an honorable defeat means. {g|Mammon}Mammon's{/g} been waiting for me for a long time now. So do me a favor, kill me now and let's be done with it." {n}An attempt of false bravado fails to make his dull voice sound more lively.{/n}
"Kill you now? Simple as that? After so many years of chasing you across all of {g|Golarion}Golarion{/g}? Oh no, no way. We're taking you back to {g|Cheliax}Cheliax{/g}."
"That's exactly what I'm going to do. Now, as for you..." {n}Linxia eyes you up and down.{/n}
"The fire, or perhaps the chopping block. The rack, perhaps the stocks. But before all that — an honest trial."
"A trial so honest that you already know the outcome."
"Ah, we have an admirer of the art! Trust me, when it comes to torture, Linxia is a true master. It's really sad that you're going to miss it all."
"At least you won't be missing anything, Darven." {n}Linxia's face winces in contempt.{/n} "Now, as for you..." {n}Linxia eyes you up and down.{/n}
"I didn't ask for your opinion. The life and death of Darven are the sole concern of the {g|Order of the Rack}Order of the Rack{/g}. Now, as for you..." {n}Linxia eyes you up and down.{/n}

"You are… an adequate… ruler." {n}Each of Linxia's words comes with tremendous effort.{/n} "I admit, I… didn't expect… a stronghold of law and order could appear in these backwaters. You have my… apologies."
"You are… an unworthy ruler." {n}Linxia makes no effort to hide her contempt.{/n} "Though I wouldn't expect anything else from a bandit lord."
"On behalf of the {g|Order of the Rack}Order of the Rack{/g}, I would like to offer you our hand in friendship. Let us join our efforts in fighting lawlessness and dissidence."
"Thank you." {n}Linxia gives you an awkward smile.{/n} "I have high expectations of our alliance."
"Sooner or later, the {g|Hellknights}Hellknights{/g} will deal with your lands and bring order here. Pray to your gods that you're dead by then."
{n}Linxia throws a withering glance at you and turns away.{/n}
"I was expecting something like this! I'm glad to be reminded that I'm an excellent judge of character — especially when it comes to the ones I put to death."
"Seeing justice served is reward enough in itself!"
{n}Darven tries to laugh, but bursts into a cough instead.{/n} "If you expected a reward, you obviously picked the wrong side."
"A fair requirement. Law must be law, and justice must be justice. Neither is meant to indulge your own sordid feelings or be entertainment for a crowd."
"We could gain some benefits from this proposition. And it would be wrong not to get anything from the order, after all the trouble its zealous follower put us through."

"Just in case, I feel I must remind you — the {g|Order of the Rack}Order of the Rack{/g} is a cult of narrow-minded fanatics who persecute scientists and artists alike. They hate technology, hate books and songs, and especially hate freedom and the right to speak one's mind."

"For once, I actually agree with Jubilost. Look in Linxia's eyes — there is nothing but the desire to exterminate and subdue! Besides, I like Darven... Regardless of his behavior, no good would come of leaving him in her hands..."
"So, what, now I have to hide all my books and manuscripts in a locked chest? What's keeping them from breaking in and burning everything down as soon as I turn around?"
{n}Amiri casts a lazy glance your way.{/n} "Can I punch her teeth out?"
"No, that's too much! We didn't help her just to have her threaten us now!"
